a:19:{s:12:"a3-lazy-load";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:12:"a3 Lazy Load";s:4:"slug";s:12:"a3-lazy-load";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.9.1";s:6:"author";s:47:"<a href="https://a3rev.com/">a3rev Software</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/a3rev";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:68;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:9;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:84;s:15:"support_threads";i:27;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:2;s:10:"downloaded";i:510000;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-08-11 2:48am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-20";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:8034:"<p>a3 Lazy Load is a Mobile Oriented, very simple to use plugin that will speed up sites page load speed. The more content heavy your site the better the plugin will perform and the more you will see the improvements in performance. See <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/stresstest1000img.htm" rel="nofollow">this demo</a> of a page with 1,000 images (yes 1,000 images) to load.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is inspired by and powered by the ressio <a href="https://github.com/ressio/lazy-load-xt" rel="nofollow">Lazy-Load-xt JavaScript</a>.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is the most fully featured, incredibly easy to set up lazy load plugin for WordPress. Use the plugins admin settings to easily define what elements are lazy loaded and when they become visible in the users browser. As the user scrolls down the page the next lot of elements you have applied lazy Load to are only loaded as they become visible in the view port.</p>
<h4>IMAGE LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>Images are the number one element that slows page load and increases bandwidth use. From the a3 Lazy Load admin panel turn load images by a3 Lazy Load ON | OFF. For more flexibility when ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for images in</p>
<ul>
<li>Post, Pages and Custom Post Types (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Widgets (Sidebar, header and footer)</li>
<li>Apply to post thumbnails</li>
<li>Apply to gravatars</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE THAN JUST IMAGES</h4>
<h4>VIDEO LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load supports all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video &#8211; for a full list see the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Embeds" rel="nofollow">WordPress Codex Embeds</a> list. The WordPress embed method of copying and pasting the video url into posts and pages content area is fully supported.</p>
<p><strong>Note</strong> &#8211; Works with Videos added by Text and HTML Widgets but not the new WordPress Video widget. That widget does not pull iframe at first load, it use JavaScript to replace html to iframe and hence a3 lazy Load can&#8217;t see it to apply.</p>
<p>From the a3 lazy Load admin panel turn Video Support ON | OFF. When ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for videos in</p>
<ul>
<li>Video embeded by URL in Post and Pages (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Video in Widget types, Text Widget and HTML Wigets.</li>
<li>Youtube <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/youtube-iframe.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Video <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/video-html5.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Fully Compatible with the popular <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/youtube-embed/">Youtube Embed Plugin</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>iFRAME LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in support for content that is added by iframe from any source in content and widgets. Examples</p>
<ul>
<li>WordPress embedded media</li>
<li>Facebook Like boxes with profiles, Like buttons, Recommend</li>
<li>Google+ Profile</li>
<li>Google Maps</li>
</ul>
<h4>POST EMBED</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fully compatible with WordPress embed post on any site feature introduced in version WP version 4.4</li>
<li>Makes embed post load much faster</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDPRESS AMP</h4>
<ul>
<li>Built in auto support for WordPress AMP plugin</li>
<li>Built in support for Better AMP plugin</li>
<li>There are no setting options for exclude /amp &#8211; Lazy Load is just never applied to the /amp endpoint</li>
<li>When the url is loaded in browser without /amp Lazy Load is applied </li>
</ul>
<h4>ADVANCED CUSTOM FIELDS</h4>
<p>Fully compatible with the very popular Advanced Custom Fields plugin, Free and Premium versions.</p>
<h4>LAZY LOAD EFFECTS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to lazy load images with a FADE IN or SPINNER effect</p>
<ul>
<li>FADEIN <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/fadein.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>SPINNER <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/spinner.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Option to create a custom Lazy Load pre-load background colour</li>
</ul>
<h4>WOOCOMMERCE</h4>
<p>a3 lazy Load is built and tested to be fully compatible with the very widely used WooCommerce plugin</p>
<h4>PERFORMANCE TWEAKS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to load its script from your sites HEAD or from the FOOT.</p>
<ul>
<li>Note that your theme must have the wp_footer() function if you select FOOTER load.</li>
<li>Note the plugin CSS is always loaded from the HEAD.</li>
</ul>
<h4>EXCLUDE IMAGES &amp; VIDEO</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load allows you to easily exclude any image or video by class name from having the Lazy Load effect applied. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/a3-lazy-load/#faq-header">See FAQ&#8217;s</a></p>
<h4>JAVASCIPT DISABLED FALLBACK</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in Noscript fallback if user has JavaScript turned off in their browser. Developers who use underscore.js in their applications can use the Noscript parameter to exclude their plugins content from Lazy Load.</p>
<h4>THEME &amp; PLUGIN COMPATIBILITY</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load works with any WordPress theme that follows the WordPress Theme Codex. However, many Theme &amp; Plugin developers will use a custom written function to add objects, example the theme has a home page with layout created by a custom function they have written. a3 Lazy Load cannot know what these functions are and so cannot apply to the objects loaded by that custom function.</p>
<p>If your images or objects not being Lazy Loaded in a certain section of your site, but are Lazy Loaded everywhere else you will know this is the cause. Please if this happens raise a support ticket with the developer, explaining that they just need to add a simple tag to their custom functions so that a3 Lazy Load apply to their custom function and be fully compatible. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/a3-lazy-load/#faq-header">Here is a list</a> of a3 lazy Load filter tags to include in your ticket to make it easy for the developer.</p>
<p>Don&#8217;t forget when a developer does add full compatibility with a3 Lazy Load please let us know via a support ticket on this forum and we will add them to the list below.</p>
<p>These are just some of the more popular plugins that are either tested 100% compatible with a3 Lazy Load or tags has been added for 100% compatibility.</p>
<ul>
<li>Plugin &#8211; Advanced Custom Fields</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WooCommerce</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WP Offload</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WP Super Cache and W3 Total Cache plugins</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; Youtube Embed</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WordPress AMP</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WPTouch. Note &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if WPTouch is installed</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; MobilePress &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if MobilePress is installed</li>
<li>Plugins &#8211; Will not conflict with any plugin that has lazy load built in</li>
<li>CDN&#8217;s &#8211; Cloudfront, Cloudflare and all other known CDN architecture.</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE FEATURES</h4>
<ul>
<li>Full support of jQueryMobile framework</li>
<li>WordPress Multi site ready.</li>
<li>Backend support for RTL display.</li>
<li>Translation ready</li>
</ul>
<h4>JOIN THE a3 LAZY LOAD COMMUNITY</h4>
<p>When you download a3 lazy Load, you join our community. Regardless of if you are a WordPress newbie or experienced developer if you are interested in contributing to a3 Lazy Load development head over to the <a href="https://github.com/a3rev/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">a3 Lazy Load GitHub Repository</a> to find out how you can contribute.<br />
Want to add a new language to a3 Lazy Load? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">translate.wordpress.org</a></p>
<h3>USAGE</h3>
<ol>
<li>Install and activate the plugin</li>
<li>Open WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Click on a3 Lazy Load menu</li>
<li>Turn ON Lazy Load and all preferred settings</li>
<li>Save Changes and enjoy the improved performance Lazy Load will give your site</li>
</ol>
";s:12:"installation";s:186:"<h4>Minimum Requirements</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 4.6 or greater</li>
<li>PHP version 5.6.0 or greater</li>
<li>MySQL version 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB version 10.0 or greater</li>
</ul>
";s:3:"faq";s:2173:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>Minimum Requirements</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 4.6 or greater</li>
<li>PHP version 5.6.0 or greater</li>
<li>MySQL version 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB version 10.0 or greater</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>How do I exclude individual objects from Lazy Load?</h4>
<p>
<p>Use this built in class name to exclude lazy load on individual images, videos and iframes.<br />
    a3-notlazy</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are some images, videos, objects not Lazy Loaded?</h4>
<p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load can only be applied to objects that are added using core WordPress functions. If your theme or a plugin developer adds objects such as images or videos via a custom written function, a3 lazy Load cannot know what that custom function is and hence cannot Lazy Load the object.</p>
<p>So if you see object not being lazy loaded please check first if those objects are loaded by the theme or a plugin. If they are, you can be confident that they are loaded by a custom function.</p>
<p>If this is the case, please help yourself and other a3 lazy Load users by raising a support ticket with the developer and ask them to add an a3 Lazy Load filter tag to their function to allow a3 Lazy Load to find it and apply to the object.</p>
<p>Below is a list of available a3 Lazy Load filters to use and pass onto the developer.</p>
</p>
<h4>Filter tags to apply lazy load</h4>
<p>
<p>Apply lazy load for images in content.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_images<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_images&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
<p>Apply lazy load for videos and iframe from content.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_videos<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_videos&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
<p>Apply lazy load for all images, videos and iframe from content<br />
    a3_lazy_load_html<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_html&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
</p>
<h4>Filter Tags to Exclude by Theme Class name</h4>
<p>
<p>Filter tags to add to class name of theme to exclude lazy load on images or videos.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_skip_images_classes<br />
    a3_lazy_load_skip_videos_classes</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:20771:"<h4>1.9.1 &#8211; 2018/08/10</h4>
<ul>
<li>This maintenance update resolves 2 issues from the v 1.9.0 upgrade</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Set min-width of placeholder to resolve any image tag that does not have width or height not showing the spinner effect. Example Gutenberg image block.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update Lazy Load extra script to resolve duplicated call time for images, iframe, videos on viewport</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.9.0 &#8211; 2018/08/06</h4>
<ul>
<li>This feature upgrade is focused on adding a number of new options for excluding Lazy Load from sections of a site. Compatibility with WordPress 4.9.8, Gutenberg 3.4.0 and WooCommerce 3.4.4</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add exclude from Lazy Load by URI</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add exclude from Lazy Load by Page types</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add support for using Wildcards in images and videos skipped classes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Upgrade lazyloadxt lib to latest version 1.1.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Rename jquery.lazyloadxt.js to jquery.lazyloadxt.extra.js</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add new Exclude by URIâ€™s and Page Types Options box and help text</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.8</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WooCommerce 3.4.4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with Gutenberg 3.4.0</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make Skip Classes feature work when have entered it to that list</li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Props to Kurt @AMPERAGE-Marketing for his contribution to this release</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.9 &#8211; 2018/06/04</h4>
<ul>
<li>This Maintenance update has 2 code tweaks for compatibility with themes and plugins that load images via the wp_kses_post sanitizer as WooCommerce does since version 3.4.0 with widgets and on Cart page.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Append lazy attributes to attribute list of allowed post tags list so that lazy load can run on frontend when that content is output via wp_kses_post </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add noscript tag to allowed post tags list to resolve duplicate image if that image is output via wp_kses_post</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WooCommerce version 3.4.1</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.8 &#8211; 2018/05/26</h4>
<ul>
<li>This maintenance update is for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.6 and the new GDPR compliance requirements for users in the EU </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.6</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Check for any issues with GDPR compliance. None Found</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.7 &#8211; 2018/03/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. 2 code tweaks to enhance the lazy loading of images, video and iframe added by third party shortcodes in the content</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Increase lazy load filter priority value so that lazy load is applied to images loaded by the shortcode function do_shortcode </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Increase lazy load filter priority value so that lazy load is applied to video and iframe loaded by the shortcode function do_shortcode</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.6 &#8211; 2018/03/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. 1 bug fix from this morning 1.8.5 major maintenance release. A small piece of new code in v 1.8.5 was written on PHP v7 and is not compatible with PHP version 5.6 If you are running v PHP 5.6 please run this update to fix it</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; PHP Fatal Error Call instance a3_lazy_load instead of us $this is not an object caused by incompatibility with PHP version 5.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.5 &#8211; 2018/03/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. Refactor of Lazy Load on Widgets, Full Compatibility with the Advanced Custom Fields plugin, optimization tweaks and 3 bug fixes.</li>
<li>Refactor &#8211; Apply lazy load to all widgets instead of Text Widget and HTML widget from WordPress</li>
<li>Refactor &#8211; Remove the code that hook to tag &#8216;wp_get_attachment_image_attributes&#8217; which was required to add support for lazy load for [gallery] shortcode. Redundant after WP version 4.6.0 and now removed.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add filter to acf_the_content tag for apply lazy load on the Content from ACF plugin. Kudos to @ondoheer for creating full compatibility with ACF Free and Premium version. </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Disable load new google fonts via API. Google fonts not used and saves 4 calls to database on each page load. Thanks to Robert Harm for reporting the issue</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Optimized loading gif compression for even faster load. Thanks @jasom for the suggestion</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove duplicate parameters from plugin scripts. Thanks to @galbaras for reporting the issue</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add new FAQs tab to plugins page with Add Lazy Load Tags to custom Function description and exclude Lazy Load Class name for easy reference.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update plugins description</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Define filter tag for enable OR disable load new google fonts via API</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Update plugin framework to new version 2.0.3</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Turn Image in Widget OFF option which had stopped working. Thanks to @japenz and @dimitar-koev for reporting and confirming the bug</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; If videos embed have preload=none do not call video load from a3 Lazy Load. Thanks to Celso Azevedo @celsoazevedo for an excellent bug report which enabled us to replicate the issue.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Remove src with placeholder image url for iframe</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.4 &#8211; 2018/02/13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. Under the bonnet tweaks to keep your plugin running smoothly and is the foundation for new features to be developed this year </li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Update a3rev Plugin Framework to version 2.0.2</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Add Framework version for all style and script files</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update for full compatibility with a3rev Dashboard plugin</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.4</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.3 &#8211; 2018/01/19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.2</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Remove redirect to plugins admin panel when activate the plugin for the first time with WordPress 4.9.2</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.2 &#8211; 2017/06/02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for compatibility with WordPress major version 4.8.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add Lazy Load support for new WordPress 4.8.0 Image, Video and Media widgets</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated Skip Image Classes and Skip Video Classes help text for better clarity </li>
<li>Fix &#8211; WordPress Admin Tool Bar User Avatar conflict Issue #2</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.1 &#8211; 2017/05/31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Use correct object A3_Lazy_Load instead of &#8216;this&#8217; as it was causing a fatal error</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.0 &#8211; 2017/05/30</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Updated for compatibility with Better AMP plugin</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Launched a3Lazy Load Github public Repository</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; WordPress Translation activation. Add text domain declaration in file header.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change global $$variable to global ${$variable} for compatibility with PHP 7.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update a3 Revolution to a3rev Software on plugins description</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update plugin framework to latest version</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.7.5</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with PHP 7.0</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Exclude images by class</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Register fontawesome in plugin framework with style name is &#8216;font-awesome-styles&#8217;</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update plugin framework to latest version</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.0 &#8211; 2016/03/01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Full compatibility with AMP plugin. No settings for it just hardcoded that Lazy Load is not applied for any url appended with /amp endpoint. Lazy load is applied to the url without the endpoint</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new &#8216;Background Color&#8217; type on plugin framework with ON | OFF switch to disable background or enable it</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; hextorgb() &#8211; for convert hex color to rgb color on plugin framework</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; generate_background_color_css() &#8211; for export background style code on plugin framework that is used to make custom style</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Saved the time number into database for one time customize style and Save change on the Plugin Settings</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Replace version number by time number for dynamic style file are generated by Sass to solve the issue get cache file on CDN server</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Define new &#8216;strip_methods&#8217; argument for Uploader type, allow strip http/https or no</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Upgraded to the latest version of a3 plugin framework</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.2</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5.2</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Define new placeholder image data for iframe. Microsoft browsers smartscreen filter was blocking the .gif placeholder loading inside iframes and throwing an unsafe website message</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0 &#8211; 2016/01/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add support for Lazy loading images, video or iframe inside content that is loaded by AJAX</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Full support for loading Product Thumbnails within the WooCommerce cart widget</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.1</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.2 &#8211; 2015/12/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change on enqueue styles and scripts for faster load</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Register new script &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt-srcset&#8217; for enqueue when lazyload script is called , full support for WP 4.4 Responsive Images</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Filter for change the &#8216;srcset&#8217; attribute name to &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; name to prevent browsers loading the image while page is loading</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Create a new script for when image comes into view port that it changes &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; to &#8216;srcset&#8217; so image is loaded then by lazy load</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.1 &#8211; 2015/12/11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the placeholder image name from &#8216;placeholder.gif&#8217; to &#8216;lazy_placeholder.gif&#8217; to avoid conflict if thumb image has name like placehoder.gif</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change pattern parameter from &#8220;/data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to &#8220;/ data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to check &#8216;data-src&#8217; exists as attribute of video, image, iframe, Solve the issue when 3rd party script adds attribute with format of name &#8216;***-data-src&#8217; to html tag.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Use preg_match( &#8220;/src=.*lazy_placeholder.gif[&#8216;\&#8221;]/s&#8221;, $imgHTML ) On themes that have loop code was causing loading of the placeholder instead of the image</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.0 &#8211; 2015/12/10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Change media uploader to New UI of WordPress media uploader with WordPress Backbone and Underscore</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Apply Lazy Load for new Embed Post feature on WordPress 4.4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update the uploader script to save the Attachment ID and work with New Uploader</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated a3 Plugin Framework to the latest version</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Full compatibility with Responsive Image feature on WordPress 4.4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the PlaceHolder image from data image to real image placeholder.gif for fix display on IE</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.4</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check if &#8216;HTTP_USER_AGENT&#8217; is defined before call it from strpos</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.1 &#8211; 2015/08/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; include new CSSMin lib from https://github.com/tubalmartin/YUI-CSS-compressor-PHP-port into plugin framework instead of old CSSMin lib from http://code.google.com/p/cssmin/ , to avoid conflict with plugins or themes that have CSSMin lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; make __construct() function for &#8216;Compile_Less_Sass&#8217; class instead of using a method with the same name as the class for compatibility on WP 4.3 and is deprecated on PHP4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; change class name from &#8216;lessc&#8217; to &#8216;a3_lessc&#8217; so that it does not conflict with plugins or themes that have another Lessc lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Plugin Framework DB query optimization. Refactored settings_get_option call for dynamic style elements, example typography, border, border_styles, border_corner, box_shadow</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.3.0</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for setup correct default settings on first installed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for reset to correct default settings when hit on &#8216;Reset Settings&#8217; button on each settings tab</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.0 &#8211; 2015/06/17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Plugin framework Mobile First focus upgrade</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Massive improvement in admin UI and UX in PC, tablet and mobile browsers</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Introducing opening and closing Setting Boxes on admin panels.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Plugin Framework Customization settings. Control how the admin panel settings show when editing.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added House Keeping &#8211; Clean up on Deletion function. ON | OFF switch is in the Plugin Framework Settings Box.  </li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added a 260px wide images to the right sidebar for support forum link, Documentation links.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce Version 2.3.11</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed Add-Ons Menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Moved plugin menu from WordPress Dashboard admin menu to a sub menu on the WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added Settings link to the plugins listing on plugin.php menu for easy access to plugin</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check &#8216;request_filesystem_credentials&#8217; function, if it does not exists then require the core php lib file from WP where it is defined</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3.0 &#8211; 2015/06/05</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Image Load Threshold with set threshold pixel dynamic setting. Default is 0px</li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/setting-threshold?replies=3" rel="nofollow">Onisforos and Matt Pain</a> for suggesting and explaining the new Threshold feature</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.2 &#8211; 2015/06/03</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_put_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_get_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.1 &#8211; 2015/05/26</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update url of dynamic stylesheet in uploads folder to the format <code>//domain.com/</code> so it&#8217;s always is correct when loaded as <code>http</code> or <code>https</code></li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to WordPress member hero12 for bringing the matter <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/css-is-not-loaded-properly-on-https?replies=1" rel="nofollow">to our attention</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.0 &#8211; 2015/05/18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added new extend script to support event when click or tap on tab to load images without having to scroll to initiate load.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested and Tweaked for full compatibility with WordPress Version 4.2.2</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed Permission 777 to 755 for style folder inside the uploads folder</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Chmod 644 for dynamic style and .less files from uploads folder</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.1 &#8211; 2015/04/21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested and Tweaked for full compatibility with WordPress Version 4.2.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update style of plugin framework. Removed the [data-icon] selector to prevent conflict with other plugins that have font awesome icons</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.0 &#8211; 2015/01/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for content that is added by iframe from any source in post and page content and widgets</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added ON | OFF option for Noscript parameter for both images and video and iframes &#8211; fallback if user does not have JavaScript support turned on in browser.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Reworked the plugins admin panel for new feature options. Separate settings for Images and Video / iframes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated all the admin panel text and add new help text.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress description with new features.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress screenshot</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress banner image.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Updated &#8216;a3_lazy_load_enable&#8217; function to edit their image or video attribute to enable a3 lazy load images or videos loaded by 3rd party application.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_image_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute to enable a3 lazy load to apply images loaded by 3rd party applications.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute so a3 lazy load script can apply to the videos, iframe.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Include &#8216;var a3_lazyload_params = {&#8220;apply_images&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;,&#8221;apply_videos&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;};&#8217; JavaScript variable into frontend that get the option that are set from admin panel. Plugin and Theme developers can use that variable inside own script to check when Lazy Load apply for Image and for Video instead of use &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; functions in PHP code</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Remove &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_classes&#8217; filter tag, we will replace another filter for separate filters for image and videos</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_images_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for images that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_videos_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for video that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to videos that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_videos&#8217; filter. Plugin and Theme developers can use this filter and parse the content with videos or iframe and the filter will return content with change on videos or iframe that a3 Lazy Load support</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.2 &#8211; 2015/01/20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Include wp_deregister_script( &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt&#8217; ) before wp_enqueue_script( &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt&#8217; ) for compatibility with a3 Portfolio plugin which supports video slides</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Add new parameter $noscript boolen type for &#8216;a3_lazy_load_html&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_images&#8217; filters to exclude or include noscript from content return of 3rd party plugins.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to images that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.1 &#8211; 2014/12/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Applied lazy load for &#8216;wp_get_attachment_image_attributes&#8217; filter tag for WordPress default [gallery] shortcode</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added link to a3 Lazy Load wordpress.org support forum on plugins description that show on plugins menu</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_enable&#8217; function when Enable Lazy Load is set to ON. Plugin and Theme developers can use the function to edit their image attribute so that a3 lazy load script can apply to the images.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for images that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Lazy Load does not apply to images added by shortcode, excluding the WordPress default [gallery] shortcode</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0 &#8211; 2014/12/20</h4>
<ul>
<li>First working release</li>
</ul>

Anti-Spam";s:4:"slug";s:7:"akismet";s:7:"version";s:5:"4.0.8";s:6:"author";s:66:"<a href="https://automattic.com/wordpress-plugins/">Automattic</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/automattic";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:700;i:4;i:37;i:3;i:11;i:2;i:5;i:1;i:33;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:786;s:15:"support_threads";i:13;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:9;s:10:"downloaded";i:118377543;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-06-19 6:18pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2005-10-20";s:8:"homepage";s:20:"https://akismet.com/";s:8:"sections";a:3:{s:11:"description";s:1059:"<p>Akismet checks your comments and contact form submissions against our global database of spam to prevent your site from publishing malicious content. You can review the comment spam it catches on your blog&#8217;s &#8220;Comments&#8221; admin screen.</p>
<p>Major features in Akismet include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Automatically checks all comments and filters out the ones that look like spam.</li>
<li>Each comment has a status history, so you can easily see which comments were caught or cleared by Akismet and which were spammed or unspammed by a moderator.</li>
<li>URLs are shown in the comment body to reveal hidden or misleading links.</li>
<li>Moderators can see the number of approved comments for each user.</li>
<li>A discard feature that outright blocks the worst spam, saving you disk space and speeding up your site.</li>
</ul>
<p>PS: You&#8217;ll need an <a href="https://akismet.com/get/" rel="nofollow">Akismet.com API key</a> to use it.  Keys are free for personal blogs; paid subscriptions are available for businesses and commercial sites.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:186:"<p>Upload the Akismet plugin to your blog, Activate it, then enter your <a href="https://akismet.com/get/" rel="nofollow">Akismet.com API key</a>.</p>
<p>1, 2, 3: You&#8217;re done!</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:21147:"<h4>4.0.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 June 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improved the grammar and consistency of the in-admin privacy related notes (notice and config).</li>
<li>Revised in-admin explanation of the comment form privacy notice to make its usage clearer.</li>
<li>Added <code>rel="nofollow noopener"</code> to the comment form privacy notice to improve SEO and security.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 28 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Based on user feedback, the link on &#8220;Learn how your comment data is processed.&#8221; in the optional privacy notice now has a <code>target</code> of <code>_blank</code> and opens in a new tab/window.</li>
<li>Updated the in-admin privacy notice to use the term &#8220;comment&#8221; instead of &#8220;contact&#8221; in &#8220;Akismet can display a notice to your users under your comment forms.&#8221;</li>
<li>Only show in-admin privacy notice if Akismet has an API Key configured</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Moved away from using <code>empty( get_option() )</code> to instantiating a variable to be compatible with older versions of PHP (5.3, 5.4, etc).</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Corrected version number after tagging. Sorry&#8230;</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26 May 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a hook to provide Akismet-specific privacy information for a site&#8217;s privacy policy.</li>
<li>Added tools to control the display of a privacy related notice under comment forms.</li>
<li>Fixed HTML in activation failure message to close META and HEAD tag properly.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that would sometimes prevent Akismet from being correctly auto-configured.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 February 2018</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a scheduled task to remove entries in wp_commentmeta that no longer have corresponding comments in wp_comments.</li>
<li>Added a new <code>akismet_batch_delete_count</code> action to the batch delete methods for people who&#8217;d like to keep track of the numbers of records being processed by those methods.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18 December 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause Akismet to recheck a comment that has already been manually approved or marked as spam.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause Akismet to claim that some comments are still waiting to be checked when no comments are waiting to be checked.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 November 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could prevent some users from connecting Akismet via their Jetpack connection.</li>
<li>Ensured that any pending Akismet-related events are unscheduled if the plugin is deactivated.</li>
<li>Allow some JavaScript to be run asynchronously to avoid affecting page render speeds.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 19 September 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added REST API endpoints for configuring Akismet and retrieving stats.</li>
<li>Increased the minimum supported WordPress version to 4.0.</li>
<li>Added compatibility with comments submitted via the REST API.</li>
<li>Improved the progress indicator on the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3 August 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Disabled Akismet&#8217;s debug log output by default unless AKISMET_DEBUG is defined.</li>
<li>URL previews now begin preloading when the mouse moves near them in the comments section of wp-admin.</li>
<li>When a comment is caught by the Comment Blacklist, Akismet will always allow it to stay in the trash even if it is spam as well.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing an error from being shown when a site can&#8217;t reach Akismet&#8217;s servers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13 July 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Reduced amount of bandwidth used by the URL Preview feature.</li>
<li>Improved the admin UI when the API key is manually pre-defined for the site.</li>
<li>Removed a workaround for WordPress installations older than 3.3 that will improve Akismet&#8217;s compatibility with other plugins.</li>
<li>The number of spam blocked that is displayed on the WordPress dashboard will now be more accurate and updated more frequently.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the Akismet widget that could cause PHP warnings.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 10 May 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug causing JavaScript errors in some browsers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 2 May 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improve performance by only requesting the akismet_comment_nonce option when absolutely necessary.</li>
<li>Fixed two bugs that could cause PHP warnings.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the &#8220;Remove author URL&#8221; feature from working after a comment was edited using &#8220;Quick Edit.&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the URL preview feature from working after a comment was edited using &#8220;Quick Edit.&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 23 February 2017</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Updated the Akismet admin pages with a new clean design.</li>
<li>Fixed bugs preventing the <code>akismet_add_comment_nonce</code> and <code>akismet_update_alert</code> wrapper functions from working properly.</li>
<li>Fixed bug preventing the loading indicator from appearing when re-checking all comments for spam.</li>
<li>Added a progress indicator to the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button.</li>
<li>Added a success message after manually rechecking the Pending queue for spam.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 September 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added a WP-CLI module. You can now check comments and recheck the moderation queue from the command line.</li>
<li>Stopped using the deprecated jQuery function <code>.live()</code>.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in <code>remove_comment_author_url()</code> and <code>add_comment_author_url()</code> that could generate PHP notices.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause an infinite loop for sites with very very very large comment IDs.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause the Akismet widget title to be blank.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.11</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 12 May 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button to skip some comments.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could prevent some spam submissions from being sent to Akismet.</li>
<li>Updated all links to use https:// when possible.</li>
<li>Disabled Akismet debug logging unless WP_DEBUG and WP_DEBUG_LOG are both enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.10</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 1 April 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could have resulted in comments that were caught by the core WordPress comment blacklist not to have a corresponding History entry.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could have caused avoidable PHP warnings in the error log.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 28 March 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add compatibility with Jetpack so that Jetpack can automatically configure Akismet settings when appropriate.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug preventing some comment data from being sent to Akismet.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 4 March 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug preventing Akismet from being used with some plugins that rewrite admin URLs.</li>
<li>Reduced the amount of bandwidth used on Akismet API calls</li>
<li>Reduced the amount of space Akismet uses in the database</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 4 January 2016</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Added documentation for the &#8216;akismet_comment_nonce&#8217; filter.</li>
<li>The post-install activation button is now accessible to screen readers and keyboard-only users.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing the &#8220;Remove author URL&#8221; feature from working in WordPress 4.4</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 14 December 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improve the notices shown after activating Akismet.</li>
<li>Update some strings to allow for the proper plural forms in all languages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13 October 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Closes a potential XSS vulnerability.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 24 September 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug that was preventing some users from automatically connecting using Jetpack if they didn&#8217;t have a current Akismet subscription.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could cause comments caught as spam to be placed in the Pending queue.</li>
<li>Error messages and instructions have been simplified to be more understandable.</li>
<li>Link previews are enabled for all links inside comments, not just the author&#8217;s website link.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 6 July 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Notify users when their account status changes after previously being successfully set up. This should help any users who are seeing blank Akismet settings screens.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 7 June 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Reduced the amount of space Akismet uses in the commentmeta table.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where some comments with quotes in the author name weren&#8217;t getting history entries</li>
<li>Pre-emptive security improvements to ensure that the Akismet plugin can&#8217;t be used by attackers to compromise a WordPress installation.</li>
<li>Better UI for the key entry field: allow whitespace to be included at the beginning or end of the key and strip it out automatically when the form is submitted.</li>
<li>When deactivating the plugin, notify the Akismet API so the site can be marked as inactive.</li>
<li>Clearer error messages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 17th March, 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Improvements to the &#8220;Remove comment author URL&#8221; JavaScript</li>
<li>Include the pingback pre-check from the 2.6 branch.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th March, 2015</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Use HTTPS by default for all requests to Akismet.</li>
<li>Fix for a situation where Akismet might strip HTML from a comment.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th December, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix to make .htaccess compatible with Apache 2.4.</li>
<li>Fix to allow removal of https author URLs.</li>
<li>Fix to avoid stripping part of the author URL when removing and re-adding.</li>
<li>Removed the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button from the &#8220;Trash&#8221; and &#8220;Approved&#8221; queues, where it would have no effect.</li>
<li>Allow automatic API key configuration when Jetpack is installed and connected to a WordPress.com account</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 3rd November, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix for sending the wrong data to delete_comment action that could have prevented old spam comments from being deleted.</li>
<li>Added a filter to disable logging of Akismet debugging information.</li>
<li>Added a filter for the maximum comment age when deleting old spam comments.</li>
<li>Added a filter for the number per batch when deleting old spam comments.</li>
<li>Removed the &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; button from the Spam folder.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18th August, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Performance improvements.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that could truncate the comment data being sent to Akismet for checking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 9th July, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Removed dependency on PHP&#8217;s fsockopen function</li>
<li>Fix spam/ham reports to work when reported outside of the WP dashboard, e.g., from Notifications or the WP app</li>
<li>Remove jQuery dependency for comment form JavaScript</li>
<li>Remove unnecessary data from some Akismet comment meta</li>
<li>Suspended keys will now result in all comments being put in moderation, not spam.</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 15th April, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Move Akismet to Settings menu</li>
<li>Drop Akismet Stats menu</li>
<li>Add stats snapshot to Akismet settings</li>
<li>Add Akismet subscription details and status to Akismet settings</li>
<li>Add contextual help for each page</li>
<li>Improve Akismet setup to use Jetpack to automate plugin setup</li>
<li>Fix &#8220;Check for Spam&#8221; to use AJAX to avoid page timing out</li>
<li>Fix Akismet settings page to be responsive</li>
<li>Drop legacy code</li>
<li>Tidy up CSS and Javascript</li>
<li>Replace the old discard setting with a new &#8220;discard pervasive spam&#8221; feature.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 18th March, 2014</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add ajax paging to the check for spam button to handle large volumes of comments</li>
<li>Optimize javascript and add localization support</li>
<li>Fix bug in link to spam comments from right now dashboard widget</li>
<li>Fix bug with deleting old comments to avoid timeouts dealing with large volumes of comments</li>
<li>Include X-Pingback-Forwarded-For header in outbound WordPress pingback verifications</li>
<li>Add pre-check for pingbacks, to stop spam before an outbound verification request is made</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.9</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 1st August, 2013</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Update &#8216;Already have a key&#8217; link to redirect page rather than depend on javascript</li>
<li>Fix some non-translatable strings to be translatable</li>
<li>Update Activation banner in plugins page to redirect user to Akismet config page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 20th January, 2013</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Simplify the activation process for new users</li>
<li>Remove the reporter_ip parameter</li>
<li>Minor preventative security improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.7</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 13th December, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>FireFox Stats iframe preview bug</li>
<li>Fix mshots preview when using https</li>
<li>Add .htaccess to block direct access to files</li>
<li>Prevent some PHP notices</li>
<li>Fix Check For Spam return location when referrer is empty</li>
<li>Fix Settings links for network admins</li>
<li>Fix prepare() warnings in WP 3.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.6</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 26th April, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Prevent retry scheduling problems on sites where wp_cron is misbehaving</li>
<li>Preload mshot previews</li>
<li>Modernize the widget code</li>
<li>Fix a bug where comments were not held for moderation during an error condition</li>
<li>Improve the UX and display when comments are temporarily held due to an error</li>
<li>Make the Check For Spam button force a retry when comments are held due to an error</li>
<li>Handle errors caused by an invalid key</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t retry comments that are too old</li>
<li>Improve error messages when verifying an API key</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.5</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 11th January, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Add nonce check for comment author URL remove action</li>
<li>Fix the settings link</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.4</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 5th January, 2012</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Limit Akismet CSS and Javascript loading in wp-admin to just the pages that need it</li>
<li>Added author URL quick removal functionality</li>
<li>Added mShot preview on Author URL hover</li>
<li>Added empty index.php to prevent directory listing</li>
<li>Move wp-admin menu items under Jetpack, if it is installed</li>
<li>Purge old Akismet comment meta data, default of 15 days</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.3</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 8th Febuary, 2011</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Specify the license is GPL v2 or later</li>
<li>Fix a bug that could result in orphaned commentmeta entries</li>
<li>Include hotfix for WordPress 3.0.5 filter issue</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.2</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 14th January, 2011</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Properly format the comment count for author counts</li>
<li>Look for super admins on multisite installs when looking up user roles</li>
<li>Increase the HTTP request timeout</li>
<li>Removed padding for author approved count</li>
<li>Fix typo in function name</li>
<li>Set Akismet stats iframe height to fixed 2500px.  Better to have one tall scroll bar than two side by side.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.1</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 17th December, 2010</em></p>

<li>Fix a bug that caused the &#8220;Auto delete&#8221; option to fail to discard comments correctly</li>
<li>Remove the comment nonce form field from the &#8216;Akismet Configuration&#8217; page in favor of using a filter, akismet_comment_nonce</li>
<li>Fixed padding bug in &#8220;author&#8221; column of posts screen</li>
<li>Added margin-top to &#8220;cleared by &#8230;&#8221; badges on dashboard</li>
<li>Fix possible error when calling akismet_cron_recheck()</li>
<li>Fix more PHP warnings</li>
<li>Clean up XHTML warnings for comment nonce</li>
<li>Fix for possible condition where scheduled comment re-checks could get stuck</li>
<li>Clean up the comment meta details after deleting a comment</li>
<li>Only show the status badge if the comment status has been changed by someone/something other than Akismet</li>
<li>Show a &#8216;History&#8217; link in the row-actions</li>
<li>Translation fixes</li>
<li>Reduced font-size on author name</li>
<li>Moved &#8220;flagged by&#8230;&#8221; notification to top right corner of comment container and removed heavy styling</li>
<li>Hid &#8220;flagged by&#8230;&#8221; notification while on dashboard</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.5.0</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 7th December, 2010</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Track comment actions under &#8216;Akismet Status&#8217; on the edit comment screen</li>
<li>Fix a few remaining deprecated function calls ( props Mike Glendinning )</li>
<li>Use HTTPS for the stats IFRAME when wp-admin is using HTTPS</li>
<li>Use the WordPress HTTP class if available</li>
<li>Move the admin UI code to a separate file, only loaded when needed</li>
<li>Add cron retry feature, to replace the old connectivity check</li>
<li>Display Akismet status badge beside each comment</li>
<li>Record history for each comment, and display it on the edit page</li>
<li>Record the complete comment as originally submitted in comment_meta, to use when reporting spam and ham</li>
<li>Highlight links in comment content</li>
<li>New option, &#8220;Show the number of comments you&#8217;ve approved beside each comment author.&#8221;</li>
<li>New option, &#8220;Use a nonce on the comment form.&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.4.0</h4>

<li>Fire the delete_comment action when deleting comments</li>
<li>Move code specific for older WP versions to legacy.php</li>
<li>General code clean up</li>

<h4>2.2.9</h4>

<ul>
<li>Eliminate a potential conflict with some plugins that may cause spurious reports</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.2.8</h4>
<p><em>Release Date &#8211; 27th May, 2010</em></p>

<li>Fix bug in initial comment check for ipv6 addresses</li>

datenschutzrechtlichen Aspekten sehr bedenklich, da personenbezogene Daten auf Servern in den USA gespeichert werden.</p>

<p>Das Team der <a href="https://inpsyde.com" rel="nofollow">Inpsyde</a> entwickelt im Web und WordPress seit 2006.</p>

<p>Du mÃ¶chtest etwas spenden &#8211; wir bevorzugen ein positives Review, nicht mehr.</p>

";s:3:"faq";s:1570:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Plugin herunterladen, entpacken, in den Ordner <code>wp-content/plugins/</code> laden und aktivieren. Oder direkt Ã¼ber den Adminbereich und &#8216;Plugins&#8217; &#8211; &#8216;Installieren&#8217; das Plugin suchen und installieren.</li>
<li>
<p>Das Plugin sollte nun automatisch unter dem Kommentarfeld den Hinweistext anzeigen. Falls nicht, muss im Theme (z.B. comments.php) manuell folgender Code innerhalb des Kommentar-Formulares, innerhalb <code>&lt;form&gt;...&lt;/form&gt;</code> &#8211; da wo der Hinweis erscheinen soll, eingefÃ¼gt werden:</p>
<pre><code>&lt;?php do_action( 'akismet_privacy_policies' ); ?&gt;
</code></pre>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Der Aufruf muss an der Stelle des Templates statt finden, wo die Ausgabe erscheinen soll.</p>
</p>
<h4>Wo finde ich weitere Informationen zum Thema Datenschutz und Akismet?</h4>
<p>
<p>Wir haben bei WordPress Deutschland einen <a href="http://http://faq.wpde.org/hinweise-zum-datenschutz-beim-einsatz-von-akismet-in-deutschland/" title="FAQ-Artikel zu Akismet" rel="nofollow">FAQ-Artikel</a>.</p>
<p>Rechtsanwalt Thomas Schwenke klÃ¤rt in einem Artikel auf: <a href="http://spreerecht.de/datenschutz/2011-04/usability-vs-datenschutz-datenschutzrechtliche-einwilligung-ohne-opt-in" rel="nofollow">Usability VS Datenschutz â€“ Datenschutzrechtliche Einwilligung ohne Opt-In?</a></p>
</p>
<h4>Plugin Dokumentation</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/inpsyde/Akismet-Privacy-Policies/wiki/Hook-Documentation" rel="nofollow">Hook-Documentation</a></li>
</ul>
</p>

Community</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:46:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/johnjamesjacoby";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:80;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:169;i:4;i:40;i:3;i:25;i:2;i:18;i:1;i:37;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:289;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:5097166;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-10-14 7:15pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-01-13";s:8:"homepage";s:19:"https://bbpress.org";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:472:"<p>Have you ever been frustrated with forum or bulletin board software that was slow, bloated and always got your server hacked? bbPress is focused on ease of integration, ease of use, web standards, and speed.</p>
<p>We&#8217;re keeping things as small and light as possible while still allowing for great add-on features through WordPress&#8217;s extensive plugin system. What does all that mean? bbPress is lean, mean, and ready to take on any job you throw at it.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1293:"<h4>From your WordPress dashboard</h4>
<ol>
<li>Visit &#8216;Plugins &gt; Add New&#8217;</li>
<li>Search for &#8216;bbPress&#8217;</li>
<li>Activate bbPress from your Plugins page. (You&#8217;ll be greeted with a Welcome page.)</li>
<li>Visit &#8216;Forums &gt; Add New&#8217; and create some forums. (You can always delete these later.)</li>
<li>If you have pretty permalinks enabled, visit yourdomain.com/forums, or if you do not have pretty permalinks enabled, visit yourdomain.com?post_type=forum</li>
</ol>
<h4>From WordPress.org</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download bbPress.</li>
<li>Upload the &#8216;bbpress&#8217; directory to your &#8216;/wp-content/plugins/&#8217; directory, using your favorite method (ftp, sftp, scp, etc&#8230;)</li>
<li>Activate bbPress from your Plugins page. (You&#8217;ll be greeted with a Welcome page.)</li>
<li>Visit &#8216;Forums &gt; Add New&#8217; and create some forums. (You can always delete these later.)</li>
<li>If you have pretty permalinks enabled, visit yourdomain.com/forums, or if you do not have pretty permalinks enabled, visit yourdomain.com?post_type=forum</li>
</ol>
<h4>Extra</h4>
<ol>
<li>Visit &#8216;Settings &gt; Forums&#8217; and adjust your configuration.</li>
<li>Adjust the CSS of your theme as needed, to make everything pretty.</li>
</ol>

ss.org/plugin/bbpress.2.0.3.zip";s:3:"2.1";s:54:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1.zip";s:10:"2.1-beta-1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1-beta-1.zip";s:7:"2.1-rc1";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1-rc1.zip";s:7:"2.1-rc2";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1-rc2.zip";s:7:"2.1-rc3";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1-rc3.zip";s:7:"2.1-rc4";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1-rc4.zip";s:5:"2.1.1";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1.1.zip";s:5:"2.1.2";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1.2.zip";s:5:"2.1.3";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.1.3.zip";s:3:"2.2";s:54:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.1";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.2.1.zip";s:5:"2.2.2";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.2.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.3";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.2.3.zip";s:5:"2.2.4";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.2.4.zip";s:3:"2.3";s:54:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.3.zip";s:9:"2.3-beta1";s:60:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.3-beta1.zip";s:5:"2.3.1";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.3.1.zip";s:5:"2.3.2";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.3.2.zip";s:3:"2.4";s:54:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.4.zip";s:5:"2.4.1";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.4.1.zip";s:3:"2.5";s:54:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.zip";s:5:"2.5.1";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.1.zip";s:6:"2.5.10";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.10.zip";s:6:"2.5.11";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.11.zip";s:6:"2.5.12";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.12.zip";s:6:"2.5.13";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.13.zip";s:6:"2.5.14";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.14.zip";s:5:"2.5.2";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.2.zip";s:5:"2.5.3";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.3.zip";s:5:"2.5.4";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.4.zip";s:5:"2.5.5";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.5.zip";s:5:"2.5.6";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.6.zip";s:5:"2.5.7";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.7.zip";s:5:"2.5.8";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.8.zip";s:5:"2.5.9";s:56:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.5.9.zip";s:10:"2.6-beta-1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.6-beta-1.zip";s:10:"2.6-beta-2";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.6-beta-2.zip";s:8:"2.6-rc-1";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.6-rc-1.zip";s:8:"2.6-rc-3";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.6-rc-3.zip";s:8:"2.6-rc-5";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.6-rc-5.zip";s:8:"2.6-rc-6";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.2.6-rc-6.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:50:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/bbpress.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:51:"https://ps.w.org/bbpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=978290";s:2:"2x";s:60:"https://ps.w.org/bbpress/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1534011";s:3:"svg";s:51:"https://ps.w.org/bbpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=978290";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:19:"broken-link-checker";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:19:"Broken Link Checker";s:4:"slug";s:19:"broken-link-checker";s:7:"version";s:6:"1.11.5";s:6:"author";s:30:"Janis Elsts, Vladimir Prelovac";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/whiteshadow";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.2";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.7";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:84;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:233;i:4;i:31;i:3;i:10;i:2;i:24;i:1;i:39;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:337;s:15:"support_threads";i:7;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:6047941;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-08-02 2:15pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-10-08";s:8:"homepage";s:50:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/broken-link-checker/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:7018:"<p>This plugin will monitor your blog looking for broken links and let you know if any are found.</p>
<p><strong>Features</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Monitors links in your posts, pages, comments, the blogroll, and custom fields (optional).</li>
<li>Detects links that don&#8217;t work, missing images and redirects.</li>
<li>Notifies you either via the Dashboard or by email.</li>
<li>Makes broken links display differently in posts (optional).</li>
<li>Prevents search engines from following broken links (optional).</li>
<li>You can search and filter links by URL, anchor text and so on.</li>
<li>Links can be edited directly from the plugin&#8217;s page, without manually updating each post.</li>
<li>Highly configurable.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Basic Usage</strong></p>
<p>Once installed, the plugin will begin parsing your posts, bookmarks (AKA blogroll) and other content and looking for links. Depending on the size of your site this can take from a few minutes up to an hour or more. When parsing is complete, the plugin will start checking each link to see if it works. Again, how long this takes depends on how big your site is and how many links there are. You can monitor the progress and tweak various link checking options in <em>Settings -&gt; Link Checker</em>.</p>
<p>The broken links, if any are found, will show up in a new tab of the WP admin panel &#8211; <em>Tools -&gt; Broken Links</em>. A notification will also appear in the &#8220;Broken Link Checker&#8221; widget on the Dashboard. To save display space, you can keep the widget closed and configure it to expand automatically when problematic links are detected. E-mail notifications need to be enabled separately (in <em>Settings -&gt; Link Checker</em>).</p>
<p>The &#8220;Broken Links&#8221; tab will by default display a list of broken links that have been detected so far. However, you can use the links on that page to view redirects or see a listing of all links &#8211; working or not &#8211; instead. You can also create new link filters by performing a search and clicking the &#8220;Create Custom Filter&#8221; button. For example, this can be used to create a filter that only shows comment links.</p>
<p>There are several actions associated with each link. They show up when you move your mouse over to one of the links listed the aforementioned tab &#8211;</p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;Edit URL&#8221; lets you change the URL of that link. If the link is present in more than one place (e.g. both in a post and in the blogroll), all occurrences of that URL will be changed.</li>
<li>&#8220;Unlink&#8221; removes the link but leaves the link text intact.</li>
<li>&#8220;Not broken&#8221; lets you manually mark a &#8220;broken&#8221; link as working. This is useful if you know it was incorrectly detected as broken due to a network glitch or a bug. The marked link will still be checked periodically, but the plugin won&#8217;t consider it broken unless it gets a new result.</li>
<li>&#8220;Dismiss&#8221; hides the link from the &#8220;Broken Links&#8221; and &#8220;Redirects&#8221; views. It will still be checked as normal and get the normal link styles (e.g. a strike-through effect for broken links), but won&#8217;t be reported again unless its status changes. Useful if you want to acknowledge a link as broken/redirected and just leave as it is.</li>
</ul>
<p>You can also click on the contents of the &#8220;Status&#8221; or &#8220;Link Text&#8221; columns to get more info about the status of each link.</p>
<p><strong>Translations</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Arabic &#8211; Yaser Maadan</li>
<li>Belorussian &#8211; <a href="http://www.comfi.com/" rel="nofollow">M. Comfi</a></li>
<li>Chinese Simplified &#8211; Kaijia Feng</li>
<li>Chinese Traditional &#8211; <a href="http://sh2153.com" rel="nofollow">YILIN</a></li>
<li>Czech &#8211; <a href="http://lelkoun.cz/" rel="nofollow">Lelkoun</a></li>
<li>Danish &#8211; <a href="http://wordpress.blogos.dk/" rel="nofollow">Georg S. Adamsen</a></li>
<li>Dutch &#8211; <a href="http://www.dreamdesignsolutions.nl/" rel="nofollow">Robin Roelofsen</a></li>
<li>Finnish &#8211; <a href="http://www.wysiwyg.fi" rel="nofollow">Jani Alha</a></li>
<li>French &#8211; <a href="http://blogs.wittwer.fr/whiler/" rel="nofollow">Whiler</a>, Luc Capronnier, <a href="http://www.michtoblog.com/" rel="nofollow">Guillaume Boda</a></li>
