<li>NEW : More methods for XMLRPC interface</li>
<li>Changed : New hooks for gallery table (THX to Alexander Schneider)</li>
<li>Changed : Introduce jQuery dialog as new UI element for WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Changed : Call TinyMCE window via admin-ajax</li>
<li>Bugfix : Better support for SSL blogs</li>
<li>Bugfix : Install/Upgrade failed when table prefix contain captial letters</li>
<li>Bugfix : Fix validation issues in Media-RSS</li>
<li>Bugfix : Empty tags in XMP Meta causes PHP error</li>
<li>Bugfix : Rework load mechanism for slideshow</li>
<li>Bugfix : Copy meta data when image is copied</li>
<li>Bugfix : Icon Support for Ozh&#8217; Admin Drop Down Menu</li>
<li>Bugfix : Use correct sort order in slideshow galleries</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.6.2 &#8211; 19.09.2010</h4>

<li>Bugfix : Load Tags library with core files</li>
<li>Bugfix : Slideshow script failed in IE7, load script now in header</li>
<li>Bugfix : Load slideshow gallery widget always</li>
<li>Changed : New admin notice for database upgrade</li>
<li>Changed : Rework crop feature of WordPress gallery plugin for featured images</li>
<li>Changed : Use site_url() instead get_option (&#8216;siteurl&#8217;), required for SSL support</li>
</ul>

<li>Changed : Include lookup for tags into the backend search</li>
<li>Changed : Restructure addgallery and settings page to enable custom tabs</li>

<li>Bugfix : Remove various PHP notices for a better world</li>
<li>Removed : Canonical link is now part of WordPress 2.9</li>

ugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.13.zip";s:5:"3.0.6";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.6.zip";s:5:"3.0.8";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.8.zip";s:5:"3.0.9";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.9.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1875408";s:2:"2x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1875408";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:21:"really-simple-captcha";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:21:"Really Simple CAPTCHA";s:4:"slug";s:21:"really-simple-captcha";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.0.1";s:6:"author";s:62:"<a href="https://ideasilo.wordpress.com/">Takayuki Miyoshi</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/takayukister";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.7";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:86;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:82;i:4;i:15;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:15;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:114;s:15:"support_threads";i:3;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:6279621;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2017-08-23 11:06am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-03-10";s:8:"homepage";s:33:"https://contactform7.com/captcha/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2807:"<p>Really Simple CAPTCHA does not work alone and is intended to work with other plugins. It is originally created for <a href="https://contactform7.com/" rel="nofollow">Contact Form 7</a>, however, you can use it with your own plugin.</p>
<p>Note: This product is &#8220;really simple&#8221; as its name suggests, i.e., it is not strongly secure. If you need perfect security, you should try other solutions.</p>
<h4>How does it work?</h4>
<p>Really Simple CAPTCHA does not use PHP &#8220;Sessions&#8221; for storing states, unlike many other PHP CAPTCHA solutions, but stores them as temporary files. This allows you to embed it into WordPress without worrying about conflicts.</p>
<p>When you generate a CAPTCHA, Really Simple CAPTCHA creates two files for it; one is an image file of CAPTCHA, and the other is a text file which stores the correct answer to the CAPTCHA.</p>
<p>The two files have the same (random) prefix in their file names, for example, &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.png&#8221; and &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.txt.&#8221; In this case, for example, when the respondent answers &#8220;K5GF&#8221; as an answer to the &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.png&#8221; image, then Really Simple CAPTCHA calculates hash of &#8220;K5GF&#8221; and tests it against the hash stored in the &#8220;a7hk3ux8p.txt&#8221; file. If the two match, the answer is confirmed as correct.</p>
<h4>How to use with your plugin</h4>
<p>Note: Below are instructions for plugin developers.</p>
<p>First, create an instance of ReallySimpleCaptcha class:</p>
<pre><code>$captcha_instance = new ReallySimpleCaptcha();
</code></pre>
<p>You can change the instance variables as you wish.</p>
<pre><code>// Change the background color of CAPTCHA image to black
$captcha_instance-&gt;bg = array( 0, 0, 0 );
</code></pre>
<p>See really-simple-captcha.php if you are interested in other variables.</p>
<p>Generate a random word for CAPTCHA.</p>
<pre><code>$word = $captcha_instance-&gt;generate_random_word();
</code></pre>
<p>Generate an image file and a corresponding text file in the temporary directory.</p>
<pre><code>$prefix = mt_rand();
$captcha_instance-&gt;generate_image( $prefix, $word );
</code></pre>
<p>Then, show the image and get an answer from respondent.</p>
<p>Check the correctness of the answer.</p>
<pre><code>$correct = $captcha_instance-&gt;check( $prefix, $the_answer_from_respondent );
</code></pre>
<p>If the $correct is true, go ahead. Otherwise, block the respondent &#8212; as it would appear not to be human.</p>
<p>And last, remove the temporary image and text files, as they are no longer in use.</p>
<pre><code>$captcha_instance-&gt;remove( $prefix );
</code></pre>
<p>That&#8217;s all.</p>
<p>If you wish to see a live sample of this, you can try <a href="https://contactform7.com/captcha/" rel="nofollow">Contact Form 7</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:416:"<p>In most cases you can install automatically from WordPress.</p>
<p>However, if you install this manually, follow these steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the entire <code>really-simple-captcha</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
</ol>
<p>FYI: There is no &#8220;control panel&#8221; for this plugin.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1260:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>In most cases you can install automatically from WordPress.</p>
<p>However, if you install this manually, follow these steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the entire <code>really-simple-captcha</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
</ol>
<p>FYI: There is no &#8220;control panel&#8221; for this plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>CAPTCHA does not work; the image does not show up.</h4>
<p>
<p>Really Simple CAPTCHA needs GD and FreeType library installed on your server. Ask your server administrator if they are installed.</p>
<p>Also, make the temporary file folder writable. The location of the temporary file folder is managed by the instance variable <code>tmp_dir</code> of ReallySimpleCaptcha class. Note that the setting varies depending on the calling plugin. For example, Contact Form 7 uses <code>wp-contents/uploads/wpcf7_captcha</code> as the temporary folder basically, but it can use different folder depending on your settings.</p>
<p>If you have any further questions, please submit them <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/really-simple-captcha" rel="nofollow">to the support forum</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:562:"<h4>2.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Does a file existence check before attempting to remove the file.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Did some rewrite of the code following the coding standard.</li>
<li>Updated the license file; added a section for bundled font files.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Change the default file mode: 0644 for image and 0640 for answer.</li>
<li>Add &#8220;Text Domain&#8221; field to the plugin header.</li>
<li>Update bundled font: Gentium Basic 1.102.</li>
<li>Add $max argument to cleanup() to prevent an endless file cleanup.</li>
</ul>

(Viper007Bond)</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/viper007bond";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:6:"rating";d:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:277;i:4;i:17;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:5;i:1;i:16;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:317;s:15:"support_threads";i:8;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:9150587;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-01-28 10:27pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2008-08-28";s:8:"homepage";s:58:"https://alex.blog/wordpress-plugins/regenerate-thumbnails/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2328:"<p>Regenerate Thumbnails allows you to regenerate all thumbnail sizes for one or more images that have been uploaded to your Media Library.</p>
<p>This is useful for situations such as:</p>
<ul>
<li>A new thumbnail size has been added and you want past uploads to have a thumbnail in that size.</li>
<li>You&#8217;ve changed the dimensions of an existing thumbnail size, for example via Settings â†’ Media.</li>
<li>You&#8217;ve switched to a new WordPress theme that uses featured images of a different size.</li>
</ul>
<p>It also offers the ability to delete old, unused thumbnails as well as update the content of posts to use the new thumbnail sizes.</p>
<h4>Alternatives</h4>
<p><strong>WP-CLI</strong></p>
<p>If you have command line access to your server, I highly recommend using <a href="https://wp-cli.org/" rel="nofollow">WP-CLI</a> instead of this plugin as it&#8217;s faster (no HTTP requests overhead) and can be run inside of a <code>screen</code> for those with many thumbnails. For details, see the documentation of its <a href="https://developer.wordpress.org/cli/commands/media/regenerate/" rel="nofollow"><code>media regenerate</code> command</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Jetpack&#8217;s Photon Module</strong></p>
<p><a href="https://jetpack.com/" rel="nofollow">Jetpack</a> is a plugin by Automattic, makers of WordPress.com. It gives your self-hosted WordPress site some of the functionality that is available to WordPress.com-hosted sites.</p>
<p><a href="https://jetpack.com/support/photon/" rel="nofollow">The Photon module</a> makes the images on your site be served from WordPress.com&#8217;s global content delivery network (CDN) which should speed up the loading of images. Importantly though it can create thumbnails on the fly which means you&#8217;ll never need to use this plugin.</p>
<p>I personally use Photon on my own website.</p>
<p><em>Disclaimer: I work for Automattic but I would recommend Photon even if I didn&#8217;t.</em></p>
<h4>Need Help? Found A Bug? Want To Contribute Code?</h4>
<p>Support for this plugin is provided via the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails" rel="nofollow">WordPress.org forums</a>.</p>
<p>The source code for this plugin is available on <a href="https://github.com/Viper007Bond/regenerate-thumbnails" rel="nofollow">GitHub</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:248:"<ol>
<li>Go to your admin area and select Plugins â†’ Add New from the menu.</li>
<li>Search for &#8220;Regenerate Thumbnails&#8221;.</li>
<li>Click install.</li>
<li>Click activate.</li>
<li>Navigate to Tools â†’ Regenerate Thumbnails.</li>
</ol>
";s:9:"changelog";s:5632:"<h4>Version 3.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix slowdown in certain cases in the media library.</li>
<li>Fix not being able to regenerate existing thumbnails for single images. Props @idofri.</li>
<li>Fix JavaScript error that could occur if the REST API response was unexpected (empty or PHP error).</li>
<li>Fix bug related to multibyte filenames.</li>
<li>If an image is used as the featured image on multiple posts, only regenerate it once instead of once per post.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 3.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Temporarily disable the update post functionality. I tested it a lot but it seems there&#8217;s still some bugs.</li>
<li>Temporarily disable the delete old thumbnails functionality. It seems to work fine but without the update post functionality, it&#8217;s not as useful.</li>
<li>Try to more gracefully handle cases where there&#8217;s missing metadata for attachments.</li>
<li>Wait until <code>init</code> to initialize the plugin so themes can filter the plugin&#8217;s capability. <code>plugins_loaded</code> is too early.</li>
<li>Fix a JavaScript error that would cause the whole regeneration process to stop if an individual image returned non-JSON, such as a 500 error code.</li>
<li>Accept GET requests for the regenerate REST API endpoint instead of just POSTs. For some reasons some people&#8217;s sites are using GET despite the code saying use POST.</li>
<li>Make the attachment ID clickable in error messages.</li>
<li>Fetch 25 attachments at a time instead of 5. I was using 5 for testing.</li>
<li>PHP notice fixes.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 3.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Complete rewrite from scratch using Vue.js and the WordPress REST API.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Better AJAX response error handling in the JavaScript. This should fix a long-standing bug in this plugin. Props Hew Sutton.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Make the capability required to use this plugin filterable so themes and other plugins can change it. Props <a href="http://jacksonwhelan.com/" rel="nofollow">Jackson Whelan</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Don&#8217;t check the nonce until we&#8217;re sure that the action called was for this plugin. Fixes lots of &#8220;Are you sure you want to do this?&#8221; error messages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix the bottom bulk action dropdown. Thanks Stefan for pointing out the issue!</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changes to the Bulk Action functionality were made shortly before the release of WordPress 3.1 which broke the way I implemented the specific multiple image regeneration feature. This version adds to the Bulk Action menu using Javascript as that&#8217;s the only way to do it currently.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Move the <code>error_reporting()</code> call in the AJAX handler to the beginning so that we&#8217;re more sure that no PHP errors are outputted. Some hosts disable usage of <code>set_time_limit()</code> and calling it was causing a PHP warning to be outputted.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>When regenerating all images, newest images are done first rather than the oldest.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug with regeneration error reporting in some browsers. Thanks to pete-sch for reporting the error.</li>
<li>Supress PHP errors in the AJAX handler to avoid sending an invalid JSON response. Thanks to pete-sch for reporting the error.</li>
<li>Better and more detailed error reporting for when <code>wp_generate_attachment_metadata()</code> fails.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Clean up the wording a bit to better match the new features and just be easier to understand.</li>
<li>Updated screenshots.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.0</h4>
<p>Lots of new features!</p>
<ul>
<li>Thanks to a lot of jQuery help from <a href="http://borisschapira.com/" rel="nofollow">Boris Schapira</a>, a failed image regeneration will no longer stop the whole process.</li>
<li>The results of each image regeneration is now outputted. You can easily see which images were successfully regenerated and which failed. Was inspired by a concept by Boris.</li>
<li>There is now a button on the regeneration page that will allow you to abort resizing images for any reason. Based on code by Boris.</li>
<li>You can now regenerate single images from the Media page. The link to do so will show up in the actions list when you hover over the row.</li>
<li>You can now bulk regenerate multiple from the Media page. Check the boxes and then select &#8220;Regenerate Thumbnails&#8221; form the &#8220;Bulk Actions&#8221; dropdown. WordPress 3.1+ only.</li>
<li>The total time that the regeneration process took is now displayed in the final status message.</li>
<li>jQuery UI Progressbar version upgraded.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Switch out deprecated function call.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Directly query the database to only fetch what the plugin needs (the attachment ID). This will reduce the memory required as it&#8217;s not storing the whole row for each attachment.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>I accidentally left a <code>check_admin_referer()</code> (nonce check) commented out.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Recoded from scratch. Now uses an AJAX request per attachment to do the resizing. No more PHP maximum execution time errors or anything like that. Also features a pretty progress bar to let the user know how it&#8217;s going.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 1.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 2.7 updates &#8212; code + UI. Thanks to jdub and Patrick F.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 1.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Initial release.</li>
</ul>

<li>Navigate to Tools â†’ Regenerate Thumbnails.</li>
</ol>
</p>

Thumbnails Advanced";s:4:"slug";s:30:"regenerate-thumbnails-advanced";s:7:"version";s:7:"1.6.3.2";s:6:"author";s:48:"<a href="https://shortpixel.com/">shortpixel</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/turcuciprian";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:78;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:11;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:15;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:182610;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-09-14 3:26pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-07-10";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://ciprianturcu.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:933:"<p><strong>A free, fast and easy to use regenerate thumbnails plugin supported by ShortPixel ðŸ™‚</strong></p>
<p>reGenerate Thumbnails Advanced (RTA) plugin comes in handy when you install a new WordPress theme on your site that has different image sizes. While the newly uploaded images will be cropped and resized to fit your new theme, the old thumbnails will remain unchanged. Using RTA you can regenerate the thumbnails for all your existing images.</p>
<p>Features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Unused thumbs of existing images are removed automatically so you won&#8217;t waste disk space.</li>
<li>Date selection (last day, week, month, all) for the thumbs that will be regenerated.</li>
<li>Clean and simple interface where you have a progress bar showing you the percentage of images regenerated.</li>
<li>You get to see the total number of images affected by your period, as well as the images affected so far when processing</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:261:"<p>Nothing special about the installation process, just visit &#8220;Plugins&#8221; section in your /wp-admin, search for &#8220;regenerate thumbnails advanced&#8221;, install &amp; activate the plugin and then from Settings section you can start using it.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:577:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>Nothing special about the installation process, just visit &#8220;Plugins&#8221; section in your /wp-admin, search for &#8220;regenerate thumbnails advanced&#8221;, install &amp; activate the plugin and then from Settings section you can start using it.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I regenerate just a few images</h4>
<p>
<p>You have the option to select from: all, past day, past week, past month</p>
</p>
<h4>What happens if I close the page and the script is loading?</h4>
<p>
<p>The script stops, it does not run in the background</p>
</p>

theme.";s:13:"download_link";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.zip";s:11:"screenshots";a:2:{i:1;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:82:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/trunk/screenshot-1.png?rev=1941417";s:7:"caption";s:36:"The options";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:10:"regenerate";s:10:"regenerate";s:5:"thumb";s:5:"thumb";s:9:"thumbnail";s:9:"thumbnail";s:10:"thumbnails";s:10:"thumbnails";s:6:"thumbs";s:6:"thumbs";}s:8:"versions";a:38:{s:3:"0.8";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.zip";s:5:"0.8.1";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.1.zip";s:5:"0.8.2";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.zip";s:7:"0.8.2.1";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.1.zip";s:7:"0.8.2.2";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.2.zip";s:7:"0.8.2.3";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.3.zip";s:7:"0.8.2.4";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.4.zip";s:7:"0.8.2.5";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.5.zip";s:7:"0.8.2.6";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.6.zip";s:7:"0.8.2.7";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.0.8.2.7.zip";s:3:"1.0";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.0.zip";s:5:"1.0.1";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.0.1.zip";s:5:"1.0.2";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.0.2.zip";s:3:"1.1";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.1";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.2";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.2.zip";s:5:"1.1.3";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.3.zip";s:5:"1.1.4";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.4.zip";s:5:"1.1.5";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.5.zip";s:5:"1.1.6";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.6.zip";s:5:"1.1.7";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.7.zip";s:5:"1.1.8";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.8.zip";s:5:"1.1.9";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.1.9.zip";s:3:"1.2";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.2.zip";s:5:"1.2.3";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.2.3.zip";s:5:"1.3.3";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.3.3.zip";s:3:"1.4";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.zip";s:5:"1.4.1";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.1.zip";s:5:"1.4.2";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.2.zip";s:5:"1.4.3";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.3.zip";s:5:"1.4.6";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.4.6.zip";s:5:"1.5.0";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.5.0.zip";s:7:"1.5.2.2";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.5.2.2.zip";s:3:"1.6";s:77:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.6.zip";s:7:"1.6.1.1";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.6.1.1.zip";s:7:"1.6.1.2";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.6.1.2.zip";s:5:"1.6.2";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.6.2.zip";s:7:"1.6.2.1";s:81:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced.1.6.2.1.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:33:"https://www.paypal.me/resizeImage";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1941417";s:2:"2x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1941417";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:15:"shariff-sharing";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:21:"Shariff for WordPress";s:4:"slug";s:15:"shariff-sharing";s:7:"version";s:6:"1.0.11";s:6:"author";s:76:"<a href="http://www.heise.de">Heise Zeitschriften Verlag / Yannik Ehlert</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/yanniksde";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.0";s:6:"tested";s:6:"4.2.21";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";d:82;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:10;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:4;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:18;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:26029;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2015-04-23 2:34pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-11-30";s:8:"homepage";s:117:"http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/c-t-entwickelt-datenschutzfreundliche-Social-Media-Buttons-weiter-2466687.html";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1146:"<p>This is the Shariff for WordPress plugin based on c&#8217;t Shariff.</p>
<p>For more information, check out the original <a href="https://github.com/heiseonline/shariff" rel="nofollow">GitHub project</a> and the <a href="http://ct.de/shariff" rel="nofollow">câ€™t information page</a>.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Shariff enables website users to share their favorite content without compromising their privacy.</p>
<p>Facebook, Google+ and Twitter supply official sharing code snippets which quietly siphon personal data from all page visitors. Shariff enables visitors to see how popular your page is on Facebook and share your content with others without needless data leaks.</p>
<p>Shariff <code>(/ËˆÊƒÉ›É¹Éªf/)</code> is an open-source, low-maintenance, high-privacy solution maintained by German computer magazine c&#8217;t and heise online.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Shariff supports sharing buttons for Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Reddit, StumbleUpon, XING, WhatsApp and mail.<br />
Select which color you want, set the button location, select the orientation fitting most to your website and set the TTL just as you want.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:246:"<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>shariff-wp</code> directory to <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code></li>
<li>Activate the plugin through th â€šPluginsâ€˜ menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Modify the settings as you want through Settings -&gt; Shariff</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:988:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>shariff-wp</code> directory to <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code></li>
<li>Activate the plugin through th â€šPluginsâ€˜ menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Modify the settings as you want through Settings -&gt; Shariff</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>How do I hide Shariff on a page?</h4>
<p>
<p><strong>Method A:</strong> Edit the article and check <code>Deactivate Shariff?</code>.</p>
<p><strong>Method B:</strong> Include <code>hideshariff</code> in the article. The word will be removed automatically and Shariff will not be shown. If you want to write hidesharrif in an article without removing Shariff, just write <code>/hideshariff</code>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Shariff doesn&#8217;t show any numbers</h4>
<p>
<p>Your user probably doesn&#8217;t have the right to write to the default temp folder <code>/tmp</code>. Then create a new folder and use it as temp folder in the Shariff settings, make sure that the rights are set correct.</p>
</p>

";s:11:"screenshots";s:825:"<ol><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1035540"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1035540" alt="&lt;code&gt;/assets/screenshot-1.png&lt;/code&gt;"></a><p><code>/assets/screenshot-1.png</code></p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1035540"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1035540" alt="&lt;code&gt;/assets/screenshot-2.png&lt;/code&gt;"></a><p><code>/assets/screenshot-2.png</code></p></li><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-3.png?rev=1035540"><img src="https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-3.png?rev=1035540" alt="&lt;code&gt;/assets/screenshot-3.png&lt;/code&gt;"></a><p><code>/assets/screenshot-3.png</code></p></li></ol>";}s:17:"short_description";s:97:"Shariff enables website users to share their favorite content without compromising their privacy.";s:13:"download_link";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shariff-sharing.zip";s:11:"screenshots";a:3:{i:1;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=1035540";s:7:"caption";s:37:"<code>/assets/screenshot-1.png</code>";}i:2;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-2.png?rev=1035540";s:7:"caption";s:37:"<code>/assets/screenshot-2.png</code>";}i:3;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/screenshot-3.png?rev=1035540";s:7:"caption";s:37:"<code>/assets/screenshot-3.png</code>";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:7:"network";s:7:"network";s:8:"networks";s:8:"networks";s:7:"privacy";s:7:"privacy";s:7:"sharing";s:7:"sharing";s:6:"social";s:6:"social";}s:8:"versions";a:0:{}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1039024";s:2:"2x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/shariff-sharing/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1039024";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}}s:7:"shariff";O:8:"stdClass":26:{s:4:"name";s:15:"Shariff Wrapper";s:4:"slug";s:7:"shariff";s:7:"version";s:5:"4.5.2";s:6:"author";s:76:"<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shariff/">Jan-Peter Lambeck & 3UU</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:34:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/3uu";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";d:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:76;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:2;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:79;s:15:"support_threads";i:14;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:219283;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-05-29 7:59pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-01";s:8:"homepage";s:41:"https://wordpress.org/plugins-wp/shariff/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1403:"<p>The &#8220;original&#8221; share buttons automatically transmit data of your visitors to the social network sites as soon as they visit your website. They do not need to click on a share button for this and therefore have no choice, if they want their data to be send. The German computer magazine c&#8217;t has developed &#8220;Shariff&#8221; <code>(ÊƒÉ›É¹Éªf)</code> that follows the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR &#8211; Regulation (EU) 2016/679). This plugin adapts the Shariff concept and provides an easy to use solution for WordPress. We currently support 32 services in 25 languages: AddThis, Bitcoin, Diaspora, Facebook, Flattr, Flipboard, GooglePlus, LinkedIn, mailto, Mastodon, Odnoklassniki, Patreon, PayPal, PayPal.me, Pinterest, Pocket, Printer, Qzone, Reddit, RSS, SMS, Stumbleupon, Telegram, TencentWeibo, Threema, Tumblr, Twitter, VK, Wallabag, Weibo, WhatsApp, Xing.</p>
<p>For more information about the Shariff project check out the original <a href="https://github.com/heiseonline/shariff" rel="nofollow">GitHub project</a> and read about the project itself <a href="http://ct.de/shariff" rel="nofollow">câ€™t information page</a> (in German).</p>
<p>You can automatically add share buttons to posts, pages, the main blog page, product sites and many more as well as use it as a widget or add the shortcode <code>[shariff]</code> manually to your pages or themes.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:333:"<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere on your site and/or use the Shariff settings menu.</li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:11543:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere on your site and/or use the Shariff settings menu.</li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the Shariff buttons in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. Simply use the shortcode function <code>do_shortcode('[shariff]')</code>.<br />
You can use all options of the shorttag as described on the help tab in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the total amount of shares in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use <code>do_shortcode('[shariff services="totalnumber"]')</code> to simply output the total amount of shares for a post in the loop. It will return the number itself wrapped in a <code>&lt;span class="shariff-totalnumber"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</code> in order for the shariff.js to update the count. Also only cached data is used, in order to not slow down your site.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Is there an action hook to use the share counts every time they get updated?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use<br />
    function your_awesome_function( $share_counts ) {<br />
       // $share_counts is an array including all enabled services, the timestamp of the update and the url of the post.<br />
       // do stuff<br />
    }<br />
    add_action( &#8216;shariff_share_counts&#8217;, &#8216;your_awesome_function&#8217; );<br />
WARNING: This hook will get called A LOT. So be sure you know what you are doing.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the widget?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: It uses the same options that have been configured on the plugin options page. However, you can put in a shorttag that overwrites the default options. It has the same format as you use in posts. Take a look at the help section of the plugin options page for more information.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I change the options on a single post?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can change all options using the shorttag in the Shariff meta box on the right side of the post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why are shares not listed?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Shariff tries to protect the privacy of your visitors. In order to do this, the statistics have to be requested by your server, so social networks only see a request of your server and not from your visitor. However, we do not know, if you want this. Therefore it is not enabled by default.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I show the share counts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Enable it on the plugin options page in general or add <code>backend="on"</code> to the shariff shorttag in your post.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I still do not see share counts</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please have a look at the status tab on the plugin options page. It states whether share counts are enabled and if there is a problem with a service. Please also keep in mind that the plugin has a minimum refresh time of 60 seconds and that each service has their own cache as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why can&#8217;t I change the TTL to a smaller / bigger value?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: The time to live (TTL) value determines, if a share count of a post or page gets refreshed when someone visits this specific page / post of your blog. Too small values create too much useless traffic, too high values negate the goal of motivating visitors to also share a post. The value can be adjusted between 60 and 7200 seconds. Keep in mind, the actual lifespan depends on the age of the post as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I get the Facebook API error message &#8220;request limit reached&#8221;!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Facebook has a rate limit of 600 requests per 600 seconds per IP address. Especially in shared hosting environments many domains share the same IP address and therefore the same limit. To avoid this you can try to raise the TTL value or provide a Facebook App ID and Secret. Google &#8220;facebook app id secret&#8221; will provide many guides on how to get these.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the position of all buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the alignment options in the admin menu or checkout the<br />
style option.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the parameters &#8220;theme&#8221;, &#8220;orientation&#8221; and &#8220;buttonsize&#8221;. They work mostly like the original code parameters that are explained at http://heiseonline.github.io/shariff/ Or you can have a look at the test page at http://shariff.3uu.net/shariff-sample-page-with-all-options to get an<br />
overview. But please be warned: This is a test page! It is possible that you find features that are only provided in the development version. Use it only to get an impression of the design options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design of a single button?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: If you are a CSS guru please feel free to modify the css file. But of course this is a bad idea, because all changes will be destroyed with the next update! Instead take a look at the style and class attribute of the shorttag. If you put in any value it will create a DIV container with the ID &#8220;ShariffSC&#8221; around the buttons. If you are really a CSS guru you will know what does the magic from here on out. ðŸ˜‰</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want the buttons to stay fixed while scrolling!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: No problem. Just use the style attribute to add some CSS to the shorttag. For example in a widget (adjust the width as needed):<br />
    [shariff style=&#8221;position:fixed;width:250px&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well. It also works with the CSS style option on the plugins design options page, if you really want this applied to all buttons on your page.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a horizontal line above my Shariff buttons!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the headline option on the design tab. For example, enter the following code to create a horizontal line and a headline:</p>
<p>Please share this post:</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a different or no headline in a single widget, post or page!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Use the headline attribute to add or remove it. For example, you can use the following shorttag to remove a headline set on the plugins options page in a single widget:<br />
    [shariff headline=&#8221;&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I add [shariff] on all posts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes, check out the plugin options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: But I want to hide it on a single post!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Do you really know what you want? ðŸ˜‰ However, it is possible. Write anywhere in your post &#8220;hideshariff&#8221;. It will be removed and Shariff will not be added. You can also use &#8220;/hideshariff&#8221; to write &#8220;hideshariff&#8221; in your post. You might also want to take a look at the Shariff meta box on the right side of your post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What are the differences between the two Shariff plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: One is developed by us, one by someone else. ðŸ˜‰ The main difference is that this plugin has a few more options and a great support. ðŸ™‚ Neither of the plugins are &#8220;official&#8221; or directly developed by Heise.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Does it work with a CDN?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Pinterest does not show an image!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can add media=&#8221;http://wwww.example.com/yourImage.png&#8221;<br />
within the [shariff] shorttag or add it in on the plugin options page &#8211; of course with the link to your image.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I set a fixed URL to share?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the &#8220;url&#8221; parameter within the shortcode<br />
    [shariff url=&#8221;http://www.example.com/&#8221;]<br />
This is also available within widgets. However, it is not a good idea to manipulate the URI, because it could mislead your visitors. So you should only use it, if this is really needed and you do really know what you are doing. Therefore it is not available on the plugin options page in general.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What happened to the Twitter share counts and what is OpenShareCount?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please read: https://www.jplambeck.de/twitter-saveoursharecounts/</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: The buttons are not correctly being shown on my custom theme!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please make sure that wp_footer(); has been added to your theme. For more information please visit: https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_footer</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What is the external API feature?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: First of all: Usually you do not need it! The plugin requests all share counts itself. However, there are some reasons to put the backend on another server:<br />
&#8211; avoid requests from you WP server to all the social networks<br />
&#8211; use a more powerful server for the statistic<br />
&#8211; use the original backend implementation of Heise or your own solution<br />
&#8211; make your own backend available for more than one WP installation<br />
But please have in mind that there are also some good reasons not to use external servers:<br />
&#8211; you need an additional installation of WP and the plugin or have to create your own implementation of a Shariff backend<br />
&#8211; some plugin settings (backend checks, statistic, etc.) will only work on the external server<br />
&#8211; you have to use SHARIFF_FRONTENDS as an array with all your frontend domains to enable the backend or find your own solution<br />
&#8211; we CANNOT provide support for your own implementation</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the external API?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: In the statistic settings fill in the URL to the API of the external server. For the WordPress installation on the external server you have to create a &#8220;constant&#8221; called SHARIFF_FRONTENDS to permit other domains to use it. Please have in mind that you have to fill in all subdomains you want to use! The domains must be defined like this:<br />
    define( &#8216;SHARIFF_FRONTENDS&#8217;, &#8216;example.com|www.example.com|blog.example.com|another-domain.com&#8217; );</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What does &#8220;Request external API directly.&#8221; mean?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: By default, the browser request the share counts from the server your site is running on. If you have entered an external API your server will then request the counts from this external API instead of fetching them itself. Therefore, the external server will only see the IP from your server and not the one from your visitors. If you check this option, the browser of your visitors will instead directly request the share counts from the external API and therefore reveal their IP address to them. This might be faster, but it is less secure. Please also make sure to set the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header right. If your site is available using https, your external API will need to be reached by https as well. Otherwise the request will get blocked for security reasons. All options and features (e.g. the ranking tab) regarding the statistic will only work on the external server.</p>
</p>
<h4>KNOWN BUGS</h4>
<p>
<p>These are bugs or unexpected glitches that we know of, but that do not have an impact on the majority of users, are not security relevant and will perhaps be fixed in the future &#8211; if we have time to spend or you provide us with a lot of &#8220;K&#xF6;lsch&#8221; ðŸ˜‰</p>
<ul>
<li>If the first post on the start page is password protected and Shariff is disabled on protected posts, a widget at the end of the loop will not be rendered.</li>
</ul>
</p>
